snippet: Khairat el-Shater, a leader of Egypt’s Muslim Brotherhood and an advocate for moderation and modernization, says that recent elections have proved that Egyptians want an explicitly Islamic state.
abstract: Khairat el-Shater has emerged as the most decisive voice in the leadership of the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt, one year after the overthrow of Hosni Mubarak brought him his freedom from prison; as the group’s chief policy architect, he is overseeing the blueprint for the new Egypt, negotiating with current military rulers over their future role, shaping relations with Israel and a domestic Christian minority, and devising economic policies the Brotherhood hopes will revive Egypt’s moribund economy (Series; The New Islamists).
lead_paragraph: Khairat el-Shater, a leader of Egypt’s Muslim Brotherhood and an advocate for moderation and modernization, says that recent elections have proved that Egyptians want an explicitly Islamic state.

headline.seo: Muslim Brotherhood Leader Rises as Egypt’s Decisive Voice
headline.main: Keeper of Islamic Flame Rises as Egypt’s New Decisive Voice
headline.print_headline: Keeper of Islamic Flame Rises As Egypt’s New Decisive Voice
